q1.title: Does the code output Hello World!?

q2.title:
Did your peer write text = 'Marvin'?
(Single or double quotes are fine)

q3.title: For each string that your peer displayed using string methods, which matches the output example, give 1 point.

q4.title: Does the code output 10.0? Is the code snippet followed?

q5.title: Does the code output the car exceeded the speed limit?

q6.title: If the output matches the example output, give 1 point. If your peer is able to output Pecos without using names[4], give 1 point.

q7.title: Ask your peer how they were able to achieve the output. For each matching output and correct explanation in every line, give 1 point.

q8.title: Set speed = 60 and run the code, output should not say over the speed limit. Set speed = 61, output should say over the speed limit. If both conditions are met, select yes.

q9.title: Run my_function(). If the code outputs Hi Marvin!, select yes.

q10.title:
Run the below code block:
say_hi('Toto')
say_hi('Fifi')

If the output matches below, select yes.
Hi Toto!
Hi Fifi!

q11.title: Run print(calculate(15,'/',5)), the code should output 3. Run again with your own set of tests including addition, subtraction and multiplication. If everything works as expected, select yes.

q12.title:
Run print(check_string('Hello World!'), check_string('The yes string'), check_string('Three four five')).

If the output matches below, select yes.
No!
Yes!
No!

q13.title: Does the output match the example output? Does the code match the code snippet? If so, select yes.

q14.title: Check if the output matches the example output. Add Egypt and Zambia to the list, the output should now also include Come and visit Egypt and Come and visit Zambia. If all checks have passed, select yes.

q15.title: Run the code multiple times, is the output random?

q1.title: Has the bot been added into the server?

q3.title: Does the bot print a login message onto the console when its ran?

q4.title: Look through your peer's code, did they use replit secrets? Make sure that their code doesn't expose their token

q5.title: Does the bot reply to the command $hello

q6.title: Does the bot reply greet the user by their name using the command $greet

q7.title: Is the bot able to repeat the user's message without include the $echo

q1.title: Does the bot reply to the command $s&p with the real time value of the stock? Make sure to check online for the actual price.

q2.title: Run the following comands $stock GOOGL , $stock META. Is the bot able to dynamically scrape the value of any stock?

q3.title: Check the code for the command, make sure the value is not hard coded. Run the command $weather, is the output accurate to the actual weather outside?

q4.title: Rate how useful/fun/creative the information scraped is.

q1.title: Does the command $quote give a random motivational quote?

q2.title: Does the command $bitcoin give the realtime price of bitcoin?

q3.title: Run the commands $crypto solana, $crypto polkadot. Is the bot able to output the prices of these cryptocurrencies?

q4.title: Run the command $malaysia_news, is the bot able give a news article related to Malaysia?

q5.title: Rigorously test the comand $news by searching for news with any keyword, example $news tech. Is the bot able to output news related to your search keyword?

q1.title: Run the command $write One Two Three Four, the bot should write these lines to a csv file. Open the csv in the replit project and make sure One Two Three Four is written in the csv.

q2.title: Run the command $read, does the bot's output include One Two Three Four?

q3.title: Ask your peer how they managed to solve this question. Run the command $analyse, is the most voted place cargo eats? Try changing the csv by making another restaurant have most amount of votes. Run the command again, did the output change?

q4.title: Run the command $vote_list, you should be able to see 5 different eateries that you can vote for. Ask your peer to show their replit, open the csv file with the 5 eateries. Run the command $vote your_favourite_place_to_eat, did your vote change the value of the csv file?
